intro: Thyrsacanthus foliaceobracteatus, commonly known as the leaf bract thyrsa, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features dense, leaf-like bracts that form a cup-like structure surrounding its small, yellow flowers. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Its unique morphology makes it an interesting subject for botanical study and horticultural cultivation.
